item.title: Self Hosting Hugo on Ubuntu Server
item.description: Getting my Hugo-powered website running on my Ubuntu server was surprisingly straightforward. I started by installing Hugo, then used the hugo new site command to set up a basic site framework. After selecting a theme, I tweaked my config.toml file and created my first Markdown post. Next, I generated the static pages with a simple hugo command. The final step was serving the site behind Nginxâ€”no complicated web apps or extra dependencies needed.
